item.title: 风险投资公司倚重人工智能不仅是为了回报
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，凯特-克拉克（Kate Clark）将报道风险投资公司如何利用人工智能技术为人工智能初创公司提供资金。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. item.title: OpenAI 支持一家试图挫败人工智能生物袭击的新企业

item.title: 英国央行迫于压力加快披露对冲基金谈判细节
item.description: 英国央行将加快公布与主要银行和对冲基金的会议纪要，因为交易员们警告说，与会者可能会不公平地获得影响市场的信息。【原文：The Bank of England will speed up the publication of minutes to its meetings with major banks and hedge funds after traders warned that the attendees may gain unfair access to market-moving information.】

item.title: 黄金和债券今年将迎来破纪录的资金流入
item.description: 股票、现金、黄金和债券将迎来有史以来最大的年度资金流入，市场上资产类别之间的传统相关性正在瓦解。【原文：Stocks, cash, gold and bonds are set for some of the largest yearly inflows on record in a market that’s seeing a breakdown in traditional correlations between asset classes.】

item.description: 即使乌克兰对炼油厂的袭击和即将到来的增税加剧了通胀风险，俄罗斯央行仍在继续其关键利率的下调周期。【原文：The Bank of Russia continued its cycle of key interest-rate cuts even as Ukrainian attacks on refineries and a looming tax increase stoke inflation risks.】

item.title: 墨西哥潮湿天气影响消费企业业绩
item.description: 尽管墨西哥股市在过去六个月里屡创新高，但消费类公司的表现却最差。尤其是瓶装饮料公司，在这个平均每人每年要喝 166 升苏打水的国家，瓶装饮料公司通常是最安全的选择。【原文：Even as Mexican stocks hit fresh record highs over the last six months, consumer companies were among the worst performers. And bottlers in particular — typically a safe bet in a country where the average person drinks 166 liters of soda a year — were the worst of the worst.】

item.title: 欧盟加强对 Meta、TikTok 的内容审核调查

item.title: 巴伐利亚北欧收购对峙演变成权力斗争
item.description: 在丹麦的投资论坛上，巴伐利亚北欧公司（Bavarian Nordic A/S）的散户股东们几周来一直在像交换战场消息一样交换信息。【原文：On Danish investment forums, retail shareholders in Bavarian Nordic A/S have for weeks traded messages like battlefield dispatches.】

item.title: 场外大买家助推 S&P 500 指数下一轮反弹
item.description: 由于担心创纪录的涨势变得过于火爆，大资金群体对股票的热情正在消退。这可能正是这轮牛市所需要的。【原文：Appetite for equities is subsiding among the big-money crowd amid anxiety that a record-smashing rally is becoming too hot. That may be just what this bull market needed.】

item.title: 内塔尼亚胡以 "他拯救了以色列 "为口号期待 2026 年大选
item.description: 两年前，哈马斯在以色列南部大肆杀戮和绑架之后，本雅明-内塔尼亚胡总理似乎完了。他自诩为 "安全先生"，要么羞愧辞职，要么被饱受摧残的民众赶下台。【原文：Two years ago, after Hamas killed and kidnapped its way across southern Israel, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu seemed finished. “Mr. Security,” as he billed himself, would either resign in shame or be driven out by a devastated public.】

item.title: 英国制造业采购经理人指数（PMI）显示：工厂反弹，英国私营部门步伐加快
item.description: 一项备受关注的调查显示，随着长达一年之久的制造业低迷期结束，10 月份英国私营部门的增长速度超过预期，这表明英国经济正开始摆脱工党增税政策的影响。【原文：The UK private sector grew faster than expected in October as a yearlong manufacturing slump came to an end, according to a closely watched survey that suggests the economy is starting to shake off the impact of Labour’s tax rises.】

item.title: 土耳其法院撤销针对反对派的案件，促进市场发展
item.description: 土耳其一家法院撤销了一起可能推翻该国主要反对党领导人的案件，这让担心政局再次动荡的投资者暂时松了一口气。【原文：A Turkish court dropped a case that could topple the leader of the country’s main opposition party, offering temporary relief to investors concerned about renewed political instability.】

item.title: 大众供应商在对峙中获得 Nexperia 芯片替代品
item.description: 法雷奥公司（Valeo SE）已经为其几乎所有的汽车产品系列找到了由Nexperia公司提供的芯片替代品，这表明该行业在努力避免迫在眉睫的停产方面取得了进展。【原文：Valeo SE has found replacements for chips supplied by Nexperia for almost its entire automotive product range, indicating industry progress on efforts to ward off looming output stoppages.】

item.title: 泰国因柬埔寨大亨的诈骗活动撤销其公民身份
item.description: 泰国政府撤销了一名柬埔寨高级商人的国籍，因为他被指控参与了网络诈骗活动和人口贩运网络。【原文：Thailand’s government revoked citizenship of a Cambodian high-ranking businessman after he was accused of being involved with cyber-scam operations and human trafficking networks.】

item.title: <strong>丹尼尔-耶金谈能源转型发生了什么</strong
item.description:

？【原文：

Why you don't hear as much about Net Zero anymore.

】

item.title: 奇货可居：丹尼尔-耶金谈 "净零 "的下场（播客）
item.description: 几年前，各国政府和企业对在应对气候变化的努力中实现净零排放的前景充满乐观。如今，你听到的这种说法已经少了很多。虽然可再生能源不断增加，但真正蓬勃发展的能源是天然气。煤炭也在蓬勃发展。到底发生了什么？世界是否有望重回正轨？在本期节目中，我们将与著名能源历史学家丹尼尔-耶金（Daniel Yergin）对话。【原文：A few years ago, governments and corporations were brimming with optimism about the prospect of getting to net zero in the efforts against climate change. Today, you hear a lot less about that. And while there’s renewables getting added to the mix all the time, one energy source that’s really booming is natural gas. And coal is booming too. So what happened? And is there any prospect of the world getting back on track? On this episode, we speak with acclaimed energy historian Daniel Yergin, curr】

item.title: 欧元区商业活动意外创 2024 年以来新高

item.title: 铜价逼近 11,000 美元，考验历史新高的时刻即将来临
item.description: 在需求普遍乐观的情况下，铜矿事故接连发生，人们担心供应问题，铜价再次冲上每吨 11,000 美元，逼近去年创下的纪录。【原文：Copper headed toward a fresh test of $11,000 a ton, closing in on a record set last year, on concerns about supplies following a spate of mine mishaps at a time of broad optimism over demand.】

item.title: 加密货币交易商避开阿尔特币，打开 8000 亿美元缺口
